III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
Safehaus is an open, short-term treatment facility, located at 21056 Dean Street,
Warren, Mi, 48091. The facility is located in a converted one and one-half story home.
One enters the facility at the lower, or basement level, through a door into the intake
office. This floor contains a full bathroom, a school area, recreation room, laundry
room, storage room, and furnace/electrical room. This basement is completely finished,
and contains egress windows, in addition to the door. The first floor of the facility
contains a small living room with couches and a television, two bedrooms with two twin
beds and one closet each, a full bathroom, a full kitchen, a community room, and an
approved behavior management room. The BMR contains a camera which also
records audio, and contains a window in the door. The two bedrooms are nicely
decorated, one for males, the other for females. The windows in these bedrooms
contain shatter-proof glass, sensors on the windows, sensors on the mattresses, and
sensors on the walls for detecting glass shattering. The second floor contains a
bedroom with two twin beds and a closet, along with a half bathroom. The room
contains egress windows, one of which has a fire escape ladder. The facility contains
video surveillance cameras in all of the rooms, excluding the two first floor bedrooms,
and the bathrooms. The second floor bedroom contains one surveillance camera,
which is directed at the stairwell, where staff will be stationed during sleeping hours.
The facility was observed to be clean and in good repair. The facility contains a fenced
in backyard.
2

B. Program Description
The program is designed to provide short-term intensive crisis residential treatment,
servicing males and females, ages 12-17 years. The program will be considered a
psychiatric hospital diversion program. The daily routine will be highly structured, and
residents will earn privileges based on their behavior and compliance with program
rules. A school program will be provided at the facility for residents. The staff to
resident ratio will be 1:5, however a minimum of two direct care staff will be scheduled
on all shifts. Therapeutic and psychiatric services will be provided to residents, along
with all medical and dental services. “A” ratings for fire safety and environmental
inspections have been received. A certificate of occupancy from the city of Warren has
also been received. The facility will accept residents who are funded through
community mental health. The facility has policies and procedures which comply with
PA 116, related to seclusion and restraint. Program policies and procedures have been
reviewed and found to be in compliance with all licensing rules and applicable statutes.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
There are no violations.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend issuance of a provisional license to this child caring institution, private.
